com.nymi.api

Class NymiDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.nymi.api.NymiDevice

  • public class NymiDevice
extends java.lang.Object
    API representation of a Nymi Band; get instances via NymiAdapter.getDevices() and NymiAdapter.NymiProvisionCallback

    The NymiDevice class is the application handle for an actual Nymi Band. Operations on Nymi Bands take user-visible time-scales; as such, requesting any operation is synchronous, but the result is returned via a callback. see sign(byte[], com.nymi.api.NymiSignatureKey, com.nymi.api.NymiDevice.NymiSignCallback) for one such example. Operations will timeout if the band is not accessible for some reason (e.g. not in range).

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public java.lang.String getId()
        Returns id of the underlying provision, a unique identifier for the Nymi Band.

        If your application stores data associated with NymiBands, it should be identified by this field.

        Returns:
        The provision id.

      • getRandom

        public void getRandom(NymiDevice.NymiRandomCallback callback)
        Requests a (very high quality) random number from the Nymi Band. Such random numbers are suitable for cryptographic operations.
        Parameters:
        callback - callback to deliver the random number to.

      • sendNotification

        public void sendNotification(NymiDevice.NymiDeviceNotification notification,
                             NymiDevice.NymiNotificationCallback callback)
        Requests to send a notification to the Nymi Band.
        Parameters:
        notification - the kind of notification to send (positive or negative)
        callback - callback to fire when operation completes.

      • sign

        public void sign(byte[] message,
                 NymiSignatureKey key,

      • sign

        public void sign(java.lang.String message,
                 NymiSignatureKey keyId,
                 NymiDevice.NymiSignCallback callback)
        Requests to sign a message (against a key stored on this NymiDevice)
        Parameters:
        message - message to sign
        keyId - Id of signing key to use key for. @see #getKeys
        callback - callback to deliver the signature to.
